Trick Eye, short for ‘trick of the eye' refers to an art technique where two-dimensional paintings are turned into three-dimensional images through the use of optical illusions. This South Korea-born gallery features a number of original, mind-blowingly deceiving artworks, as well as newly created and adapted pieces for its Singapore site. Marvel at 2D paintings on museum walls, floors and ceilings - and try to wrap your head around the way they all pop out and come to life! Visitors are more than welcome to explore the six themed galleries with their eyes, hands, and of course, their camera. So step inside paintings, hang from a wooden beam, and get creative with your poses as you snap some photos and trick any onlooker's eyes!

Despite its rich historical background, the museum's galleries have adopted the latest cutting edge display techniques that redefine the traditional museum experience. From humble beginnings to the present day metropolis, you'll learn about everything from daily life to the rapid development of this island nation over 700 years of Singapore history. The National Museum of Singapore hosts a variety of exhibitions, festivals, film screenings and thought-provoking performances all year round – so you are sure to witness a truly great event during your visit.

National Gallery Singapore is the largest visual arts venue and museum in Singapore – home to over 1,000 art works and it is certainly one of the main attractions in Singapore. Visitors are introduced to Singaporean and Southeast Asian art in the long-term and special exhibitions taking place at the gallery. A visit to the National Gallery Singapore is a great opportunity to discover art, culture and architecture of Singapore.

Trickeye, short for ‘trick of the eye' refers to an art technique where two-dimensional paintings are turned into three-dimensional images through the use of optical illusions. You're visiting the home of Trickeye, the South Korean original museum that has now found roots across the world. Marvel at 2D paintings on the museum walls, floors and ceilings – and try to wrap your head around how they pop out and come to life! Visitors are allowed to freely explore the multiple galleries with their eyes, hands, and of course, cameras. So step inside paintings, hang from beams, ride a camel, dance with the pros and swing with Spiderman.

strIntroduction: Increase your knowledge of the clash between North and South Korea by visiting the DMZ with an interesting guide and learn more about the significant role it plays in times of war Learn more about the Korean War and the Cold War from your informative English-speaking guide Visit the sites of recent history between North and South Korea including Imjingak Park, Freedom Bridge, 3rd Infiltration Tunnel and the DMZ Exhibition Hall Choose the lunch option for a meal at a local restaurant – a chance to reflect on your tour View North Korea through binoculars atop the Dora Observatory Countries restricted from entering the JSA (Panmunjom) will still be able to join this tour Learn more about the Korean War and the Cold War from your informative English-speaking guide Learn more about the Korean War and the Cold War from your informative English-speaking guide Visit the sites of recent history between North and South Korea including Imjingak Park, Freedom Bridge, 3rd Infiltration Tunnel and the DMZ Exhibition Hall Visit the sites of recent history between North and South Korea including Imjingak Park, Freedom Bridge, 3rd Infiltration Tunnel and the DMZ Exhibition Hall Choose the lunch option for a meal at a local restaurant – a chance to reflect on your tour Choose the lunch option for a meal at a local restaurant – a chance to reflect on your tour View North Korea through binoculars atop the Dora Observatory View North Korea through binoculars atop the Dora Observatory Countries restricted from entering the JSA (Panmunjom) will still be able to join this tour Countries restricted from entering the JSA (Panmunjom) will still be able to join this tour What We Love:   What We Love: This is a tour to take you deep into the DMZ (Demilitarized Zone), just a few miles from North Korean territory, to discover more about Korea's turbulent past. Despite its name, the DMZ is the area between two of the most heavily armed frontiers on earth. However, this no man's land is remarkably safe for tourists (and even world leaders) to visit, but is only accessible via group tours. Your guide will relate the fascinating history surrounding the area as you visit historical sites: war relics at Imjingak Park, Freedom Bridge across which almost 13,000 Korean POWs walked to freedom, the 3rd Infiltration Tunnel - an invasion route built beneath the border, the DMZ exhibition theater, and views of North Korea from atop the Dora Observatory.

strIntroduction: Get the most comprehensive tour of the no man's land between North and South Korea. Visit key sites of the DMZ in the morning and enter the high security area of the JSA in the afternoon Learn more about tensions between the Koreas and the wars that have resulted, from your informative English-speaking guide Visit famous sites of the DMZ including Imjingak Park, Freedom Bridge, the 3rd Infiltration Tunnel, the DMZ exhibition hall and the Dora Observatory Enter the JSA to see Freedom House, Conference Room, Bridge of No Return and the Ax Murder Incident area Enjoy a delicious local lunch and hotel pick-up included Learn more about tensions between the Koreas and the wars that have resulted, from your informative English-speaking guide Learn more about tensions between the Koreas and the wars that have resulted, from your informative English-speaking guide Visit famous sites of the DMZ including Imjingak Park, Freedom Bridge, the 3rd Infiltration Tunnel, the DMZ exhibition hall and the Dora Observatory Visit famous sites of the DMZ including Imjingak Park, Freedom Bridge, the 3rd Infiltration Tunnel, the DMZ exhibition hall and the Dora Observatory Enter the JSA to see Freedom House, Conference Room, Bridge of No Return and the Ax Murder Incident area Enter the JSA to see Freedom House, Conference Room, Bridge of No Return and the Ax Murder Incident area Enjoy a delicious local lunch and hotel pick-up included Enjoy a delicious local lunch and hotel pick-up included What We Love:   What We Love: Whether a fan of history and politics or not, a visit to the border territory between North and South Korea is an eye-opening experience. You'll travel to the Demilitarized Zone (DMZ), a buffer between the two sides, and explore historic sites including Imjingak Park, the Freedom Bridge and the secretly dug 3rd Infiltration Tunnel. After stopping for a local lunch, you'll be escorted through the checkpoint at Panmunjom (officially known as the Joint Security Area (JSA)), a supposedly neutral zone in times of war where the two sides met. Here you'll visit Freedom House and learn about the Bridge of No Return and the Ax Murder Incident. At which point you'll be able to say you have technically entered North Korea! If you currently feel like you lack knowledge on the subject, not to fear, you'll be an expert after taking this tour.

Stroll the ‘Forest of Sweethearts' and keep an eye out for ostriches, rabbits, deer and other wildlife that roam freely through the forest. The 150-year-old residences of Petite France, based on the iconic book ‘The Little Prince', are bound to transport your thoughts to quaint French villages. It's also the set for many scenes from ever-popular Korean drama ‘My Love from the Star'. For a dose of exercise during the tour, opt to experience the ‘Rail Bike' and pedal along the rail tracks while taking in the lovely Bukhangang River scenery!

Being non-verbal, the show is accessible to all nationalities, whether you've grown up a K-food lover or not (warning: you will be by the end of this!) Performers mimic the sound of making bibimbap with beat-boxing, a cappella, acrobatics and martial arts. It's heralded as the pioneer of a new fad called ‘Eatertainment'! Two chefs battle it out in the kitchen to create the best bibimbap dish with the winner judged by a randomly selected audience member. It's not all bibimbap though, expect sushi, pizza, and chicken noodles too, served with a b-boying accompaniment. Suited to gastronomes and thespians alike, this innovative and dynamic performance is a self-proclaimed ‘delicious musical'.

What We Love:   What We Love: Putting a unique Korean spin on the Romeo and Juliet story, FANTA-STICK shakes up the traditional Korean performance with a modern interpretation. The synopsis involving two families, an ethereal drum and flute and even ghosts, is based loosely on the Shakespeare classic combined with an impressive array of breakdancing, martial arts, dance and traditional Korean percussion and string music, with a healthy dollop of comedy thrown in for good measure. You'll be drawn in by the pulsating percussive rhythm and the heartwarming melodies in beautiful ‘Gukak' style (Korean traditional music), redefining how the modern world sees this ancient genre.

Enjoy an evening of dynastic culture over an incredible spread of court-style foods from the Joseon period or watch the talented performers of a traditional show Visit Korea House, famed for 5* performances and award-winning cuisine Feel like royalty with a lavish meal of Joseon Dynasty dishes, prepared by award-winning chefs Dishes are prepared following the traditional methods described in ancient literature such as the state banquet hotpot Settle in for the 8 cultural performances involving traditional Korean song and dance on stage for over 32 years and performed over 16,000 times! What We Love:   What We Love: Receive the royal treatment at the beautiful Korea House, Seoul's famed cultural building specializing in traditional court cuisine and cultural performances. Your evening will begin with an incredible banquet of Korean dishes, as eaten in the Joseon Dynasty described in historic texts, prepared by superior chefs under the supervision of the world's top Korean court cuisine expert. Whichever menu you choose, you'll experience famed dishes under the soft lighting of traditional silk lanterns. When your taste buds are satisfied, it's time for the one-hour performance of eight traditional acts with everything from fan dances to percussion to romantic drama. The show has been staged for over 32 years and enjoyed by over 1.6 million people from around the world. At the end, you'll have the opportunity to take photos with the performers in their spectacular costumes.

strIntroduction: Experience the entire journey of one of K-Pop's biggest bands, BIGBANG, since their first debut at this limited-time exhibition until 30 October! Immerse yourself in the life of BIGBANG as you celebrate their 10th anniversary Explore the exhibition, divided into 5 themes: BIGBANG as musicians, BIGBANG on stage, BIGBANG as an icon, BIGBANG in the past 10 years and BIGBANG in the future 10 years Meet BIGBANG in person (almost!) with the most modern virtual reality technology See the band's original outfits, equipment, music, photos and more This limited time exhibition is open from now until October 30th - don't miss it! Relive the story of one of Korea's most popular boy bands from the very beginning at the BIGBANG 10: A to Z Exhibition. As one of the most popular and symbolic groups of the K-Pop world, BIGBANG has undergone many ups and downs throughout their journey. Join their huge fan following on a rollercoaster of emotions as you discover first-hand what their most cherished memories have been and what their plans are for the future. See the real music albums, photos, clothing, videos, interviews and even music video sets from the past 10 years and come face-to-face with BIGBANG using state of the art virtual reality equipment. This is a dream come true for every BIGBANG fan out there!

strIntroduction: Get your Korean culture fix with this morning tour of a famed palace, museum and Buddhist temple in Seoul, supplemented by the expert knowledge of your English-speaking guide Drive past and learn more about the President's pad, Blue House (or Cheongwadae) Watch the changing of the guards and tour the spectacular Gyeongbokgung Palace Visit the National Folk Museum to build your knowledge of Korean history Visit tranquil Jogyesa Buddhist Temple, an important building for Zen Buddhism in Korea Make a quick stop off at a Ginseng Center, one of Korea's major exports Drive past and learn more about the President's pad, Blue House (or Cheongwadae) Drive past and learn more about the President's pad, Blue House (or Cheongwadae) Watch the changing of the guards and tour the spectacular Gyeongbokgung Palace Watch the changing of the guards and tour the spectacular Gyeongbokgung Palace Visit the National Folk Museum to build your knowledge of Korean history Visit the National Folk Museum to build your knowledge of Korean history Visit tranquil Jogyesa Buddhist Temple, an important building for Zen Buddhism in Korea Visit tranquil Jogyesa Buddhist Temple, an important building for Zen Buddhism in Korea Make a quick stop off at a Ginseng Center, one of Korea's major exports Make a quick stop off at a Ginseng Center, one of Korea's major exports What We Love:   What We Love: Start your morning of Korean culture with a tour of Seoul's largest (and arguably most beautiful) palace. Gyeongbokgung Palace, built in the 1300s, has been destroyed and reconstructed many times, but you'll be relieved it's still here today for you to stroll the spacious grounds, intricate architecture and grand pavilions. Combine this with a guided visit of the National Folk Museum and your knowledge of Korean history will be fit to burst! Along the way, your informative tour guide will relate facts about areas of interest, particularly related to the distinguished Joseon Dynasty. Realize the deep significance of Buddhism in Korean culture at Jogyesa Temple, a tranquil refuge from the megacity outside and the leading center of Zen Buddhism in Korea.

Visit famous filming locations as featured in a hit Korean TV show including Petite France and the Korean Folk Village with drop off at the K-Pop hologram hall! Visit famous locations from the smash hit Korean TV series 'My Love from the Star' Roam the French-themed streets of Petite France Visit the ‘centuries-old' Korean Folk Village or scale the 300m N Seoul Tower Pick up some bargains at a short duty-free shopping session in downtown Seoul Watch K-Pop performances at your leisure at Klive Visit famous locations from the smash hit Korean TV series 'My Love from the Star' Visit famous locations from the smash hit Korean TV series 'My Love from the Star' Roam the French-themed streets of Petite France Roam the French-themed streets of Petite France Visit the ‘centuries-old' Korean Folk Village or scale the 300m N Seoul Tower Visit the ‘centuries-old' Korean Folk Village or scale the 300m N Seoul Tower Pick up some bargains at a short duty-free shopping session in downtown Seoul Pick up some bargains at a short duty-free shopping session in downtown Seoul Watch K-Pop performances at your leisure at Klive Watch K-Pop performances at your leisure at Klive What We Love:   What We Love: In this diverse tour of Seoul and the surrounding area, you'll visit famous filming locations inspired by the hit Korean TV Drama, ‘My Love from the Star'. Whether a fan of the show or not, the locations and landmarks visited on this tour are not to be missed. Roam the quaint streets of Petite France and immerse yourself in the European vibes of charming cafes and French architecture. Then visit the Korean Folk Village, a Joseon Dynasty reconstruction, where you'll experience Korean life from as far back as the 14th Century. You can choose to visit 300m N Seoul Tower for amazing views of the city which ooze romance (it's a favored location for Seoulite couples). Pick up some duty-free bargains in downtown Seoul before the final stop (here's to you K-Pop lovers), a gallery where you can watch hologram performances!

Discover the thrills of biking on the Gangchon rail road - a popular spot appearing in many Korean variety shows including 'Running Man' and 'We Got Married' Climb aboard the old train tracks and experience an exciting bike ride in the beautiful countryside Book two or four seat bikes on a route that starts from the Gimyujeong Station to the Gangchon Station Explore the beauty of the Bukhangang River on a bike ride - a perfect activity for the whole family Relax your legs when you arrive to the Gangchon Station with a free shuttle bus ride back to Gimyujeong Station Climb aboard the old train tracks and experience an exciting bike ride in the beautiful countryside Book two or four seat bikes on a route that starts from the Gimyujeong Station to the Gangchon Station Explore the beauty of the Bukhangang River on a bike ride - a perfect activity for the whole family Relax your legs when you arrive to the Gangchon Station with a free shuttle bus ride back to Gimyujeong Station What We Love:   What We Love: The Gangchon Rail Bike is a popular activity on Nami Island, allowing visitors to pedal along old railroad tracks while taking in the scenery of the lovely 318km Bukhangang River. You will be able to experience a piece of history when you travel the same route the Mugunghwa train traveled for a span of 70 years! The Gimyujeong Station course is approximately 8.5km long with the first section (6km) lasting around 50 minutes. After riding the first 6km you will arrive at a transfer station where you will be able to take a bathroom break or pick up a snack from the cafeteria. From there continue on a 20 minute romantic train ride where you are not required peddle! Once you arrive at the Gangchon Station make sure to grab the free shuttle back to where you started.
strTitle: Gangchon Rail Bike on Nami Island

strIntroduction: Try your hand at making some of Korea's most famous export - kimchi, learn all about Korean culture and dress up in traditional costume Learn how to make delicious kimchi, instructed by professional Korean chefs with a choice of three cultural package options Try your hand at other Korean snacks such as Tteokbokki - a popular and tasty spicy rice cake Dress up in traditional Korean robes, the Hanbok with your friends and snap that perfect Instagram shot! Learn more about ancient Korean culture from your guide and host Learn how to make delicious kimchi, instructed by professional Korean chefs with a choice of three cultural package options Learn how to make delicious kimchi, instructed by professional Korean chefs with a choice of three cultural package options Try your hand at other Korean snacks such as Tteokbokki - a popular and tasty spicy rice cake Try your hand at other Korean snacks such as Tteokbokki - a popular and tasty spicy rice cake Dress up in traditional Korean robes, the Hanbok with your friends and snap that perfect Instagram shot! Dress up in traditional Korean robes, the Hanbok with your friends and snap that perfect Instagram shot! Learn more about ancient Korean culture from your guide and host Learn more about ancient Korean culture from your guide and host What We Love:   What We Love: Learn how to make the two most famous Korean dishes, Kimchi and Tteokbokki (spicy rice cake), in Myeongdong, in the heart of Seoul - Korea's vibrant capital. Apart from learning the secret behind making great kimchi, your hosts for the day will also let you try on a Hanbok, the Korean traditional costume. After snapping some shots of your Korean garb, enjoy your kimchi or take it home to eat later. The course is ideal for beginners, and is particularly focused on those hoping to learn more about Korean culture in an all-encompassing and practical manner. The professional instructors taking the class will teach you how to make kimchi step by step and tell you interesting historical and cultural facts about kimchi. The perfect food and culture class giving an introduction to Seoul!

Step into the heat and explore the traditional Korean jjimjilbang bathhouse culture offered at the Itaewon Land Spa and Bathhouse Visit one of the most popular Korean-style 'jjimjilbang' bathhouses in Seoul Cleanse your pores in a variety of saunas that include salt, soil, minerals and even ice Relax in the steam rooms or cool and warm pools Unwind from your stressful day in a traditional pinewood sauna Perfect for busy schedules with entrance times available 24/7 Visit one of the most popular Korean-style 'jjimjilbang' bathhouses in Seoul Cleanse your pores in a variety of saunas that include salt, soil, minerals and even ice Relax in the steam rooms or cool and warm pools Unwind from your stressful day in a traditional pinewood sauna Perfect for busy schedules with entrance times available 24/7 What We Love:   What We Love: Itaewon Land Spa and Bathhouse is a 'jjimjilbang' that is one of the most popular destinations for foreigners and travelers in Seoul. Open for over 10 years, this traditional Korean bathhouse is famous for its outdoor 'hanok' appearance (a traditional-style Korean house) and its intricate interior designs. There are a number of saunas each with different minerals that help boost blood circulation and help perspiration and detoxification. If you are a traveler with any body aches and pains, want to smoothen your skin or simply want to take a break and relax, then Itaewon Land is perfect for you! Visiting a traditional Korean jjimjilbang is certainly one of the essential things to do in Seoul.

Talented breakdance performers from across South Korea gather to perform in the world's first B-Boy theater, an intimate set up which encourages the audience to get involved! The mix of breakdancing, hip-hop, R&B and charged dance battles will be sure to get your heart beating and adrenalin pumping. Receiving tumultuous accolade after their world tour, the show is a must-see for any dance and B-Boy fans.

you a total Seoul immersion. Marvel at the architecture of one of Seoul's most beautiful palaces, Gyeongbokgung. Resulting from a stormy history, ongoing reconstructions mean you can see original portions alongside modern efforts to restore it to its former glory. Reminisce to bygone days with a guided visit of the National Folk Museum before a tasty local lunch. After you're fully sated, you'll set off to visit palace no.2, UNESCO-listed Changdeokgung, a perfectly preserved architectural example from the Joseon Dynasty. Walk amongst the serenity of Jogyesa Buddhist Temple, peruse crafts and antiques on Insadong Street and pick up a holiday memento at Namdaemun before a comfortable transfer back to your hotel.

Follow the story of three friends coming of age in a musical of dance and comedy that'll be sure to have you dancing in your seat! Absorb the energy of the incredible dancers at this sell-out show After performing in countries across the world, you can now see this show in its Seoul home This non-verbal show means language barriers are not a problem Absorb the energy of the incredible dancers at this sell-out show Absorb the energy of the incredible dancers at this sell-out show After performing in countries across the world, you can now see this show in its Seoul home After performing in countries across the world, you can now see this show in its Seoul home This non-verbal show means language barriers are not a problem This non-verbal show means language barriers are not a problem What We Love:   What We Love: ‘Sachoom' is a spectacular dance musical bringing audiences up close to a range of powerful, live dance genres including hip-hop, jazz, contemporary dance, break dancing and more. This non-verbal performance subtitled in a number of languages and following a simple plot allows it to be enjoyed by spectators across the globe. The show has been performed in a record-breaking 32 cities worldwide, consistently receiving rave reviews. The energy that these performers create will undoubtedly inspire you to get dancing!

Spend a half-day getting a real cultural insight into Korean customs, ceremony and the country's favorite fermented food – Kimchi! Attend a tea ceremony, and learn about Korean tea etiquette and its recent revival Try on a traditional hanbok and take a memorable photo Make kimchi and find out why it's a healthy Korean staple Enjoy the convenience of complimentary hotel transfers Attend a tea ceremony, and learn about Korean tea etiquette and its recent revival Attend a tea ceremony, and learn about Korean tea etiquette and its recent revival Try on a traditional hanbok and take a memorable photo Try on a traditional hanbok and take a memorable photo hanbok Make kimchi and find out why it's a healthy Korean staple Make kimchi and find out why it's a healthy Korean staple Enjoy the convenience of complimentary hotel transfers Enjoy the convenience of complimentary hotel transfers What We Love:   What We Love: Gain a deeper knowledge of Korean food, customs and etiquette with a traditional tea ceremony, a *hanbok* dress-up session and kimchi making class! Begin by attending a tea ceremony where your friendly guide will explain the etiquette which has recently enjoyed a revival in modern society. Afterwards, try on a colorful *hanbok*, the traditional Korean clothing dating from the Joseon period and take the opportunity to pose for a photo – say ‘Kimchi!' Next get stuck in to your kimchi-making class led by a local cook. Korea's well-loved fermented dish, primarily made from cabbage, is served at most meals and has many a positive benefit to the diet. Taste your creation or pack it up to go before heading back to your hotel, with a quick stop at the amethyst factory, a famed Korean export, on the way.

Be introduced to the world of Korean cooking with a beginner's course and learn to create traditional dishes Learn to create two delicious Korean dishes taught by an experienced chef Choose from a wide variety of classes from Korean street food to bulgogi and kimchi Go on a trip to the traditional market in Korea Get assistance and guidance from an experienced chef with years of knowledge in Korean cuisine Learn to create two delicious Korean dishes taught by an experienced chef Choose from a wide variety of classes from Korean street food to bulgogi and kimchi Go on a trip to the traditional market in Korea Get assistance and guidance from an experienced chef with years of knowledge in Korean cuisine What We Love:   What We Love: Whether your cooking skills are bare minimum or you're new to cooking Korean food, this course is designed for beginners to successfully learn how to create traditional Korean dishes. You are immersed in the entire cooking experience from buying ingredients with a traditional market tour near the cooking studio. After a demonstration by an experienced chef, you get to try your hand in creating the dishes with tips and guidance from the chef the whole way through. Best of all, you get to taste the fruits of your labor once the cooking's over!

Taste a variety of popular Korean street foods and an optional traditional BBQ lunch around the historical Jongno area Enjoy different types of street food including Korean style egg muffin, spicy rice cake and fried pork dumplings Go on a walking food tour where the guide will introduce you to 7 different foods in two hours Learn about the history and food culture of Korea from an experienced guide Finish with a full-course Korean BBQ lunch to complete the experience Choose the Mini Korean Taste Tour which excludes the BBQ lunch for those who want to focus solely on street food Enjoy different types of street food including Korean style egg muffin, spicy rice cake and fried pork dumplings Go on a walking food tour where the guide will introduce you to 7 different foods in two hours Learn about the history and food culture of Korea from an experienced guide Finish with a full-course Korean BBQ lunch to complete the experience Choose the Mini Korean Taste Tour which excludes the BBQ lunch for those who want to focus solely on street food What We Love:   What We Love: Go in search of the best street food in Seoul with an experienced guide who will lead you to classic shops, street stalls and restaurants. Listen to the history and food culture of Korea while savoring tasty street snacks including fried pork dumplings and Korean rice cakes. Feeling adventurous? We dare you to try the silkworm larva! Once you've taken a bite of the best street snacks in Seoul, you can enjoy a full-course Korean BBQ lunch which is sure to leave you fully satisfied.
strTitle: Korean Street Food and BBQ Tour

strIntroduction: Say hello to your favorite stars from around the world at the Grevin Living Waxwork Museum in Seoul See over 88 wax figures, including singers, movie stars and sports players Meet and interact with your favorite world-class stars including Hollywood actors and many idolized K-Pop stars Learn more about the history and culture of Korea through the fashion and icons of K-Pop over the years Enjoy High Tea at Cafe Grevin during your visit with the optional High Tea set See over 88 wax figures, including singers, movie stars and sports players Meet and interact with your favorite world-class stars including Hollywood actors and many idolized K-Pop stars Learn more about the history and culture of Korea through the fashion and icons of K-Pop over the years Enjoy High Tea at Cafe Grevin during your visit with the optional High Tea set What We Love:   What We Love: See over 88 vivid wax figures of the most popular stars from around the world, including your favorite K-Pop stars. You are free to touch the stars and take selfies with all of them! The Grevin Living Waxwork Museum is housed in a building that was originally a relic of the Seoul government with profound historic and architectural meaning. The inside has since been reconstructed into the biggest wax statue museum in all of Asia! Give yourself plenty of time to explore the museum's 7 marvelously themed halls. Each exhibition hall is equipped with high-end technology that allows you to interact with your favorite idols through lifelike gestures, actions and vocal sounds. Get ready to enter a world of fame and fortune with endless fascination as you come up close and personal with the stars stars. Wrap up your visit with a delectable High Tea at Cafe Grevin and indulge in a selection of cakes and macaroons.

Savor the taste of Korean food and drink in Seoul at four different establishments in three hours with a local guide Savor different types of Korean food and drink from four different places in one night Visit restaurants that are famous among Korean locals with your friendly guide Have an enjoyable night out where you will be able to learn local eating and drinking customs, Korean phrases and drinking games Savor different types of Korean food and drink from four different places in one night Visit restaurants that are famous among Korean locals with your friendly guide Have an enjoyable night out where you will be able to learn local eating and drinking customs, Korean phrases and drinking games What We Love:   What We Love: Discover quintessential Korean culinary institutions like Korean barbecue and national beverage soju with an experienced guide who will show you famous eating spots. Enjoy sampling a different dish accompanied by a different local beverage at four locations in Seoul while mingling with other food lovers. Dine on Korean barbeque and rice cakes, washed down with beer or rice wine. Munch on crispy mung bean pancakes from traditional Kwangjang market in the winter or cool, Korean ice cream (patbingsu) in the summer. It is a night to get to know Korea through its food with insights into Korean culture, fun Korean phrases and drinking games throughout. Come with a hungry stomach and thirst for local culture on this Korean dining adventure!

Dive into Korean history with a comprehensive tour of palaces, temples, museums and even a village reconstruction, dating back to the Joseon Dynasty Drive past and learn more about the President's pad, Blue House Watch the changing of the guards and tour the spectacular Gyeongbokgung Palace Visit the National Folk Museum to build your knowledge of Korean history Visit tranquil Jogyesa Buddhist Temple, an important building for Zen Buddhism in Korea Walk amongst traditional houses at the Korean Folk Village, an authentic reconstruction of a Joseon Dynasty village Tap into your English-speaking guide's in depth knowledge of Korean history Enjoy hotel pick-up and drop-off Drive past and learn more about the President's pad, Blue House Drive past and learn more about the President's pad, Blue House Watch the changing of the guards and tour the spectacular Gyeongbokgung Palace Watch the changing of the guards and tour the spectacular Gyeongbokgung Palace Visit the National Folk Museum to build your knowledge of Korean history Visit the National Folk Museum to build your knowledge of Korean history Visit tranquil Jogyesa Buddhist Temple, an important building for Zen Buddhism in Korea Visit tranquil Jogyesa Buddhist Temple, an important building for Zen Buddhism in Korea Walk amongst traditional houses at the Korean Folk Village, an authentic reconstruction of a Joseon Dynasty village Walk amongst traditional houses at the Korean Folk Village, an authentic reconstruction of a Joseon Dynasty village Tap into your English-speaking guide's in depth knowledge of Korean history Tap into your English-speaking guide's in depth knowledge of Korean history Enjoy hotel pick-up and drop-off Enjoy hotel pick-up and drop-off What We Love:   What We Love: You'll soon be imagining yourself in the days of yore with a tour of Seoul's cultural heritage, from the palaces of royalty to the ancient homes of ordinary people. Begin with the beautiful pavilions and spacious grounds of Gyeongbokgung Palace, then your informative guide will lead you on a guided tour of the National Folk Museum to find out about the daily lives of Koreans spanning pre-historic times to the end of the Joseon Dynasty. Explore the peaceful grounds of Jogyesa Buddhist Temple before settling down for a traditional Korean meal. After lunch you'll experience a Joseon Dynasty throwback when you visit the Korean Folk Village. Walk amongst traditionally built houses, watch artisans in action at a handicraft workshop, join the audience of a folk performance, and even try your hand at traditional games such as arrow throwing and seesaw jumping!

Choose between three different class options and immerse yourself in Korean food culture Explore local Korean culture through the art of cooking with an experienced chef Pick from three interesting courses - vegetarian temple cuisine, banchan culture or Korean barbecue Get assistance and guidance from an experienced chef with years of knowledge in Korean cuisine Explore local Korean culture through the art of cooking with an experienced chef Pick from three interesting courses - vegetarian temple cuisine, banchan culture or Korean barbecue Get assistance and guidance from an experienced chef with years of knowledge in Korean cuisine What We Love:   What We Love: Prepare a meal which reflects a special segment of Korean culture with your choice of three course options: a completely vegetarian spread that reflects the cooking methods of Korean Buddhist monks, small dishes (banchan) with special techniques and philosophy for making them, or Korea's meaty sample, barbecue. After a thorough demonstration from experienced chefs, the hands-on work begins as you learn how to create some of the region's most delicious dishes. By learning some special tips and tricks, impress your family and friends with your ability to cook up a Korean storm in your own kitchen!

Discover the amazing collection of unique modern art and 3D exhibitions on show at one of Korea's favorite galleries Step into the paintings and become part of the art work at this fun 3D museum Snap funny shots as you walk around the gallery Create your own unique masterpieces at the glow in the dark scribbles gallery Step into the paintings and become part of the art work at this fun 3D museum Step into the paintings and become part of the art work at this fun 3D museum Snap funny shots as you walk around the gallery Snap funny shots as you walk around the gallery Create your own unique masterpieces at the glow in the dark scribbles gallery Create your own unique masterpieces at the glow in the dark scribbles gallery What We Love:   What We Love: Discover some of South Korea's most vibrant art and start your Seoul experience with a bang at the fantastic 3D Art Museum Black Art! With multiple exhibitions to take in, you'll happily spend hours of fun here taking in the incredible art before your eyes and taking more than a few fun photos.. Stand inside 3D paintings and be part of the art, or experience the mystery of scenes from the movie 'Avatar' in the Avatar exhibition. Those with a creative flair can have fun in front of the scribbles wall and make your own art at the glow in the dark exhibits. The gallery promises total enjoyment and a unique and interesting trip in Seoul for all the family!

Visit the Korean Folk Village and learn more about traditional Korean culture from the late Joseon period The ideal place to start your Korea trip and learn more about ancient Korean culture Experience the shooting location of several popular Korean TV dramas such as Jewel in the Palace and My Love from the Star! Learn more about the ancient Korean arts such as embroidery and basket making Taste traditional and authentic Korean food like Bibimbap at the onsite restaurants The ideal place to start your Korea trip and learn more about ancient Korean culture The ideal place to start your Korea trip and learn more about ancient Korean culture Experience the shooting location of several popular Korean TV dramas such as Jewel in the Palace and My Love from the Star! Learn more about the ancient Korean arts such as embroidery and basket making Learn more about the ancient Korean arts such as embroidery and basket making Taste traditional and authentic Korean food like Bibimbap at the onsite restaurants Taste traditional and authentic Korean food like Bibimbap at the onsite restaurants What We Love:   What We Love: Make the short trip from Seoul and discover more about ancient Korean culture at the country's premier folk village. You'll learn more about traditional Korean clothing and food whilst exploring the workshops and multiple other attractions at this splendid attraction. The village's grounds includes a Folk Museum and Art Museum where you are given the chance to get up close and personal with the secret behind making handmade baskets, musical instruments and embroidery for which the Joseon Dynasty of Korean was well known for. With over 260 replica Joseon Dynasty houses to explore, and daily traditional dances and live music performances to enjoy plus excellent food on site, this is a great way to start your Korea experience!

Experience this luxurious ginseng spa in the popular Gangnam area, for a tranquil environment and professional massage services Choose from 6 different spa packages available, tailored to fit your needs Increase blood circulation with a water massage in the Hongsam Spa Room Relieve stress with the popular foot massages in the Foot Spa Zone Stimulate scalp health through the use of red ginseng products at Head Spa Zone Detoxify and nourish your body through heat and steam treatments Choose from 6 different spa packages available, tailored to fit your needs Increase blood circulation with a water massage in the Hongsam Spa Room Relieve stress with the popular foot massages in the Foot Spa Zone Stimulate scalp health through the use of red ginseng products at Head Spa Zone Detoxify and nourish your body through heat and steam treatments What We Love:   What We Love: Your SPA G experience will be dedicated to ensuring you get the most relaxing treatments for mind, body and soul. The tranquil space located in the heart of Gangnam consists of five individual therapy rooms that are sure to release your stress, refresh your body and make you feel rejuvenated from the inside and out! Cheongkwanjang SPA G was founded by the Korea Ginseng Corporation that uses only high-quality hongsam (red ginseng). The Korea Ginseng Corporation started their red ginseng business back in 1899 within the royal palace of the Korean Empire and have continued to maintain the highest standards due to their meticulous quality control so you can be guaranteed a special and luxury experience at the Cheongkwanjang SPA G.

Get your cameras ready for the best location in Seoul to take pictures with life-size teddy bears or try to and escape the mirror maze Meet teddy bears dressed as your favorite Korean celebs, in traditional clothes from around the world or even as gods from Greek mythology Visit multiple exhibition rooms such as the Safari room, Chocolate room, Aqua room, Korean Culture room and more Find your way through the Mirror Maze - a special exhibition covered in mirrors where you must feel your way out Purchase your own teddy bears to take home with you at the Teseum gift store Meet teddy bears dressed as your favorite Korean celebs, in traditional clothes from around the world or even as gods from Greek mythology Visit multiple exhibition rooms such as the Safari room, Chocolate room, Aqua room, Korean Culture room and more Find your way through the Mirror Maze - a special exhibition covered in mirrors where you must feel your way out Purchase your own teddy bears to take home with you at the Teseum gift store What We Love:   What We Love: Visit Teseum Seoul and interact with the life-size teddy bears at this world renowned museum, making for a quirky place to snap photos with your family and friends. The museum is divided into multiple themed sections where you are free to move around and explore at your own pace. Learn about Korean culture in a unique way as you explore the exhibitions of teddy bears in traditional Korean dress and even mimicking famous celebrities, sure to bring a smile to your face. Venture into the mirror maze and try to make your way out amid the confusion of glass and your own reflections! Stop by the gift shop on your way out to purchase your own teddy bear or take one home as a gift to a loved one.

Meet your favorite animation characters, watch live shows and parades, and shop and dine at all themed areas of Seoul Land! Experience the twists and turns on over 40 rides including the popular 100km/h Black Hole 2000 roller coaster Stay late and catch the psychedelic Laser Show held every evening Stimulate your senses with the 3D and 5D action movies Celebrate year-round with multiple seasonal festivals hosted at the park including the Halloween and Christmas Experience the twists and turns on over 40 rides including the popular 100km/h Black Hole 2000 roller coaster Stay late and catch the psychedelic Laser Show held every evening Stimulate your senses with the 3D and 5D action movies Celebrate year-round with multiple seasonal festivals hosted at the park including the Halloween and Christmas What We Love:   What We Love: Seoul Land, renowned as Korea's first large-scale theme park, is surrounded by beautiful scenery and has rides for all ages! Get your adrenaline pumping at the rapid roller coasters and rides throughout the five themed areas of the park! Themes include the World Plaza, Adventure Land, Fantasy Land, Tomorrow Land and Samchulli Hill. For those not fond of adventure rides, take a moment to walk through the greenery and World Square to catch a glimpse of traditional architecture from all over the world. There's something fun for every person in your family, no matter the age!

Witness first-hand the intensity of training involved in becoming a fireman during a comedic performance of the Fireman Show The show uses a mixture of performance styles to express the demands of being a fireman Witness impressive acrobatic lifts and flips Feel the positive energy brought by the dramatic yet comical performers that portray very dynamic characters Learn about the importance of fire safety and awareness throughout the show This non-verbal show is suitable for all language speakers The show uses a mixture of performance styles to express the demands of being a fireman Witness impressive acrobatic lifts and flips Feel the positive energy brought by the dramatic yet comical performers that portray very dynamic characters Learn about the importance of fire safety and awareness throughout the show This non-verbal show is suitable for all language speakers What We Love:   What We Love: The Fireman Show is the latest show in Seoul showcasing the strength, tough training and dedicated work of a fireman! There's no need to know any Korean because this non-verbal performance transcends all languages. Follow the story of a group of trainees who struggle to get through their strenuous and high intensity training in order to become skillful firemen. Watch in awe as the performers dance, do parkour, acrobatic lifts, flips and other intricate moves. Marvel at the stage lighting and effects while enjoying this unique and funny show. By the end of the show you will have a new perspective of the fun and excitement involved in a fireman trainee's day to day life on the field.

No previous experience? No problem - the coaches from the Korean national shooting team will train you one-on-one to help you succeed under the best possible supervision. This is the go-to place to practice your shooting because they provide you with a very realistic shooting experience. The shooting activity is divided into 5M, 10M and 15M ranges for you to try. After spending some time shooting be sure to check out the luxurious inside lounge where you can relax, take photos or order a drink.

See Seoul from the staggering height of 817ft at the top floor of the 63 Building offering mind-boggling views of the city and river below! Visit the 63 Building – a signature architectural landmark of South Korea and the tallest gold-clad structure in the world Go up to the 60th floor and capture breathtaking photos of Seoul and the Han River Enjoy panoramic views of the city and explore the building's various entertainment facilities from an IMAX to an aquarium! What We Love:   What We Love: The 63 Building, also known as the Hanhwa 63 City, is a skyscraper on Yeouido island boasting stunning views of the Han River and the city of Seoul. Opened in July 1985, the building is the tallest gold-clad structure in the world and a must-see landmark in South Korea. The 63 Building stands tall at 817ft and comprises 60 floors and 3 basement levels – offering plenty of space to explore and amazing scenery down below to admire. However, the building is much more than an observation tower. It's a multi-venue leisure complex containing every form of entertainment imaginable. Inside, you will find an IMAX cinema, art gallery, wax museum, performance hall and even an aquarium.

Experience the underwater world up close and personal as you interact with the sea life, watch otters swim beneath your feet and watch the special mermaid show! Marvel at the beauty of 20,000 sea creatures from over 400 species Track the migration patterns of species in the 200 ton Migratory Tank Visit the troublemaking and playful harbor seals during one of their four daily shows Admire the South American sea lion and California sea lion during one of their three musical daily show Watch real life swimmers perform an underwater mermaid show in the main tank Marvel at the beauty of 20,000 sea creatures from over 400 species Track the migration patterns of species in the 200 ton Migratory Tank Visit the troublemaking and playful harbor seals during one of their four daily shows Admire the South American sea lion and California sea lion during one of their three musical daily show Watch real life swimmers perform an underwater mermaid show in the main tank What We Love:   What We Love: Hanwha Aqua Planet 63 in Seoul is a must-see attraction located inside the iconic 63 Building, a perfect day out for the whole family. It's known for its 5,630 square meters space and hosts a million visitors each year. Get a chance to see many different kinds of animals including penguins, arapaimas, piranhas, otters, harbor seals, sea lions and more. The aquarium mimics ocean habitats from around the world to give you an insight into the marine world like no other aquarium in Korea. Make sure to spend time in the main tank, where you can catch the aquarium's most unique attraction - a fantastic mermaid show, set to music and lights!

Get involved in a culinary show whilst enjoying night views on a cruise of the Han River - the fourth longest river in Korea Take part in the interactive Pang Show that originates from a popular 2010 Korean drama Capture the best night view of the Han River and its surroundings Learn to bake bread from Korea's most talented professional performers During the winter, the cruise takes a stop at Banpo Bridge for the enchanting moonlight fountain show Take part in the interactive Pang Show that originates from a popular 2010 Korean drama Capture the best night view of the Han River and its surroundings Learn to bake bread from Korea's most talented professional performers During the winter, the cruise takes a stop at Banpo Bridge for the enchanting moonlight fountain show What We Love:   What We Love: Experience Pang Show on an E-LAND Cruise, a show that perfectly integrates sightseeing and an interactive baking experience. Learn to make delicious bread in a 30 minute hands-on experience on board the E-LAND Cruise before viewing the Guinness World Record-breaking Han River rainbow fountain at Banpo Bridge (the world's longest bridge fountain) and other scenic night views along the Han River! Next you'll get to experience the exciting culinary Pang Show on E-LAND Cruise, an adaptation of the well-known Korean drama 'King of Baking, Kim Takgu', which has been televised in a total of 12 countries across Asia. The show depicts how an apprentice goes through various challenges in order to make bread that will please the audience. The Pang Show is a hands-on variety show that invites you to participate in baking bread. Watch skilled performers in the arts of drumming, dance, acrobatics, and stand-up comedy. After the show, warm, freshly-baked 'pang' will be served.

strIntroduction: Visit Seoul's themed action heroes museum to discover an impressive range of characters at Figure Museum W in Seoul Immerse yourself in the museum's six themed exhibitions There's a favorite hero for all: from the legendary Robot Taekwon V, to the contemporary superhero Spider Man and more Entertain the kids at the play zone, photo zone, or with figure making programs suitable for all ages Purchase your own action figures with the help of figure experts Visit the exact location of the date scene of Korean actors So Ji Sub and Shin Min Ah in the drama 'Oh My Venus' Immerse yourself in the museum's six themed exhibitions There's a favorite hero for all: from the legendary Robot Taekwon V, to the contemporary superhero Spider Man and more Entertain the kids at the play zone, photo zone, or with figure making programs suitable for all ages Purchase your own action figures with the help of figure experts Visit the exact location of the date scene of Korean actors So Ji Sub and Shin Min Ah in the drama 'Oh My Venus' What We Love:   What We Love: Located in Gangnam, Seoul, the Figure Museum W is a new concept museum that merges figurines, toys, and a theme park all into one. It is a must see for any fans of action figures because you get a chance to view highly-prices limited edition figures in cutting-edge exhibitions. The exhibits range from the legendary figures of Maginger Z, Gundams, and Robot Taekwon V, all the way to familiar contemporary heroes including Superman, Batman, and Iron Man. Many Korean Hallyu stars, including D.O of EXO, Lee Jong Seok, Lee Wang Soo, Ko So-Young and Lim Si Wan, have visited and shown great interest in the collection. It's a great place for all ages to gain knowledge about the art and culture of action figures. If you're sad to leave the figures and toys behind at the end of your visit, consult the museum's figure experts and purchase action figures to start your own collection at home!

Due to its high quality service, the Myeongdong Traditional Sauna is very popular and attracts foreign tourists and local residents alike. Open your pores in a steamy sauna, indulge in a facial cleanse or condition your skin with a scrub. Your body will thank you as you take a break from sightseeing and relax with one of the four packages offered. Once you're rejuvenated, make sure to stop by the shops on the bustling Myeongdong commercial street located near the sauna.

Visit one of the 'Seven Wonders of Winter' and go fishing for mountain trout at the Hwacheon Sancheoneo Ice Festival Carve out a hole and fish for 'Sancheoneo' cold water mountain trout Cook up your freshly caught fish and eat it for lunch Enjoy the convenience of shuttle bus transfers to and from Seoul Learn more about the festival and Korean culture from your English speaking guide Try out a number of other winter activities on the ice such as sledging and ice soccer! Carve out a hole and fish for 'Sancheoneo' cold water mountain trout Cook up your freshly caught fish and eat it for lunch Enjoy the convenience of shuttle bus transfers to and from Seoul Learn more about the festival and Korean culture from your English speaking guide Try out a number of other winter activities on the ice such as sledging and ice soccer! What We Love:   What We Love: Don't let the chilly weather put you off visiting South Korea in winter. Take the opportunity to experience a unique Korean winter festival, in celebration of Mountain Trout (Hwacheon Sancheoneo)! Follow the locals on their annual pilgrimage into the beautiful mountainous countryside away from the city. Dig holes into the hard ice and fish for fresh trout as part of this hundreds of years old tradition. When you've made your catch, have it cooked up for consumption at the festival kitchen. Afterwards, spend some time trying out the numerous ice activities on offer such as ice sledging,, bobsled, ice soccer, ice sculptures and much more wintry fun. With transportation to and from the festival included, plus the useful addition of an informative English speaking guide, this activity comes highly recommended for anyone looking to venture beyond the city and get a unique insight into Korean culture.

Choose from over a 100 firearms that have been featured in many of your favorite action movies and dramas. This shooting range is well-known throughout Korea for having trained various 'Hallyu' stars, including Kim Soo-hyun, Tiffany (Girls' Generation), G-Dragon (Bigbang), Yoon Doo-joon and Lee Gi-kwang (Beast), CL (2NE1), Shin Se-kyung, and more!

Discover the wonders of action painting in The Original Drawing Show, the first non-verbal performance art show in the world! Started in 2007, the show is a perfect mix of art, music, and humor, perfect for all ages. Watch in awe as the performers use various techniques such as finger painting, marble drawing, light drawing, and more to create works of art in mere minutes! The process of creating the work and seeing the fantastic transformation of artwork being drawn and completed at high speeds will keep you on the edge of your seat!

Visit Aqua Planet to discover a 2000 ton water tank, 44 smaller water tanks, 9 animal breeding facilities, and a bird breeding farm all in one location! Delve into the mysterious ocean ecosystem through a huge 11m x 6m observatory window Feel and pet the underwater creatures and hold colorful birds at the Touch Pool and Parrot Village Walk through two large tunnel water tanks and watch as underwater creatures swim all around Watch the fascinating mermaid-like Dream Girls perform their daily underwater show Check out the Ocean Arena's live ecology sessions with aquarists who will teach you a thing or two about sea elephants and harbor seals Delve into the mysterious ocean ecosystem through a huge 11m x 6m observatory window Feel and pet the underwater creatures and hold colorful birds at the Touch Pool and Parrot Village Walk through two large tunnel water tanks and watch as underwater creatures swim all around Watch the fascinating mermaid-like Dream Girls perform their daily underwater show Check out the Ocean Arena's live ecology sessions with aquarists who will teach you a thing or two about sea elephants and harbor seals What We Love:   What We Love: Aqua Planet near Seoul boasts the largest complex in the capital area that provides hands-on underwater observation facilities. Interact with a variety of animals such as penguins, sand tiger sharks, jaguars, otters, beavers, and ring-tailed lemurs and more! Explore the two popular tunnel water tanks - the 2nd floor Saltwater Tunnel and the 3rd floor Freshwater Tunnel. Make sure to check out one of the five Dream Girls Performance that play daily showcasing a synchronized media show between the sea and screen. Keep your cameras at the ready - this is a trip the whole family will enjoy!
